001package imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.nonlinear;
002
003
004import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.mod;
005import static java.lang.Math.atan2;
006import static java.lang.Math.cos;
007import static java.lang.Math.exp;
008import static java.lang.Math.hypot;
009import static java.lang.Math.log1p;
010import static java.lang.Math.sin;
011
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Inversion;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
015
016/**
017 * <p>
018 * This class implements a 2D log-polar mapping transformation. Simple version
019 * (Version 1), maps radius [0,rmax] to [0,nr]). See Sec. 21.1.6 (Eq. 21.65 -
020 * 21.70) of [1] for additional details and examples.
021 * </p>
022 * <p>
023 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
024 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
025 * </p>
026 * 
027 * @author WB
028 * @version 2022/11/16
029 */
030public class LogPolarMapping1 implements Mapping2D, Inversion {
031        
032        private static final double PI2 = 2 * Math.PI;
033        
034        private final double xc, yc;                    // center point in source image
035        private final int P;                                    // # of radial steps
036        private final double c1, c2, c3, c4;    // pre-calculated constants
037        
038        /**
039         * Constructor.
040         * @param xc x-coordinate of center point in source image
041         * @param yc y-coordinate of center point in source image
042         * @param P number of radial steps
043         * @param Q number of angular steps
044         * @param rmax maximum radius
045         */
046        public LogPolarMapping1(double xc, double yc, int P, int Q, double rmax) {
047                this.P = P;
048                this.xc = xc;
049                this.yc = yc;
050                this.c1 = this.P / log1p(rmax);
051                this.c2 = Q / PI2;
052                this.c3 = PI2 / Q;
053                this.c4 = log1p(rmax) / P;
054        }
055        
056        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
057        
058        @Override
059        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d xy) {                                        // image -> log-polar
060                double dx = xy.getX() - xc;
061                double dy = xy.getY() - yc;
062                double r = hypot(dx, dy);
063                double rho = c1 * log1p(r);                                             // = Math.log(r + 1)    
064                double theta = mod(atan2(dy, dx), PI2);                 // theta in [0, 2 PI)
065                double omega = c2 * theta;
066                return Pnt2d.from(rho, omega);
067        }
068        
069        @Override
070        public Mapping2D getInverse() {                                         // log-polar -> image
071                return new Mapping2D() {
072                        @Override
073                        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d ra) {
074                                double rho = ra.getX();
075                                double omega = ra.getY();
076                                double r = exp(rho * c4) - 1;
077                                double theta = c3 * omega;
078                                double x = r * cos(theta);
079                                double y = r * sin(theta);
080                                return Pnt2d.from(xc + x, yc + y);
081                        }
082                };
083        }
084
085}
